turns.utterance: Ugh, I'm so frustrated. I can't seem to log into my account. I've tried resetting my password multiple times, but nothing seems to work.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Let's try to get this sorted out for you. Can you please provide me with the email address or username associated with your account?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's jane.doe@email.com. I really need to check my balance and transfer some funds.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. Please wait one moment while I verify your account. Okay, it looks like there might be a temporary lock on your account due to multiple failed login attempts. I can unlock it for you now. To confirm, can you tell me the last four digits of your social security number?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's 4321. Thanks for unlocking it. Now, how do I set up a recurring transfer of $200 from my checking to my savings account every month?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: To set up a recurring transfer, navigate to the 'Transfers' section of your online banking portal. Then, select 'Schedule a Transfer' and follow the on-screen instructions to specify the amount, frequency, and accounts involved. You will need to authenticate your identity to finalize the setup.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I see that. But what happens if the transfer date falls on a weekend or a holiday? Will it be processed the next business day or the previous one? And how does that affect potential overdraft fees if the balance is low on the original date?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a great question. Generally, if a scheduled transfer date falls on a weekend or holiday, the transfer will be processed on the *next* business day. Regarding overdraft fees, our system attempts to process transfers even with low balances, potentially triggering an overdraft if sufficient funds aren't available when the transfer is actually processed. To avoid this, ensure your account has enough funds a few days *prior* to the scheduled transfer date. You can also enroll in overdraft protection or link another account to cover potential shortfalls. I recommend reviewing our overdraft policy on the website for more specific details.
